title: Journey: Taiko Arabia Hantou de no Kiseki to Tatakai no Monogatari
content:
based on the Quranic chapter 105 "Al-Fil" (The Elephant), is a powerful and thought-provoking retelling of a religious tale that is not often explored in anime. The attention to detail and respect paid to the source material is evident in every frame, and the animation is top-notch, with a great blend of 2D and 3D elements that bring the story to life in a visually stunning way.

The characters in the story are well-developed and relatable, with a particular emphasis on Aws Ibn Jubair and Zurara. The dynamic between the two former friends, and their individual journeys to redemption, is a highlight of the movie. Thesound and music are also a standout, with an amazing soundtrack that perfectly captures the emotion of the story.

It was an incredibly enjoyable and thought-provoking experience. It's a movie that manages to blend different cultures and religious references in a respectful and considerate way. It's a good watch for anyone who is a fan of anime, but also for those who are interested in exploring different interpretations of religious stories. It's a well-crafted and well-executed film that is well deserving of the critical acclaim it has received. It's a great example of how collaboration between different cultures can lead to successful and powerful storytelling.

Overall: 7.7/10.
